metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1088 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A privilege escalation flaw was found in gluster 3.x snapshot scheduler.Any gluster client allowed to mount gluster volumes could also mount sharedgluster storage volume and escalate privileges by scheduling maliciouscronjob via symlink.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1088` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 4.0.2-1
glusterfs-common - 4.0.2-1
glusterfs-server - 4.0.2-1
libgfapi0 - 4.0.2-1
libgfchangelog0 - 4.0.2-1
libgfrpc0 - 4.0.2-1
libgfxdr0 - 4.0.2-1
libglusterfs0 - 4.0.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.2-1').
